identificationModule.briefTitle: Soft Robotic Hand System for Stroke Rehabilitation
identificationModule.officialTitle: Soft Robotic Hand System for Stroke Rehabilitation

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The soft robotic system could provide objective and quantifiable measures of subject performance. By combining voluntary motor intention and the robotic hand technology, the system will facilitate the recovery process of stroke patients.

armGroups.label: EMG-driven soft robot hand
armGroups.description: subjects will receive EMG-driven soft robot hand system.

armGroups.label: sham group
armGroups.description: subjects will receive passive pre-programmed soft robot hand system.

interventions.name: soft robot hand system
interventions.description: subjects will wear the soft robot hand system and receive 60 minutes (including preparation time) hand exercise.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Scale from 0 to 4, whereas 0 is no increase in tone and 4 is limb rigid in flexion or extension

locations.facility: Department of Biomedical Engineering, The Chinese University of Hong Kong
